channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8282] User triggered flushes does not allow compaction to get triggered even if compaction criteria is met
item.description:
Observe the below logs


2013-04-04 17:43:45,825 INFO org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegionServer: Flushing MyTable,,1365111467842.f6792086ad3518dee244e7bf2761a1f9.

2013-04-04 17:47:57,203 DEBUG org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.wal.SequenceFileLogWriter: Path=hdfs://localhost:9010/hbase/.logs/ram.sh.intel.com,60020,1365040136175/ram.sh.intel.com%2C60020%2C1365040136175.1365112077196, compression=false

2013-04-04 17:47:57,208 INFO org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.wal.FSHLog: Rolled log for file=/hbase/.logs/ram.sh.intel.com,60020,1365040136175/ram.sh.intel.com%2C60020%2C1365040136175.1365111909450, entries=70, filesize=64871151; new path=/hbase/.logs/ram.sh.intel.com,60020,1365040136175/ram.sh.intel.com%2C60020%2C1365040136175.1365112077196

2013-04-04 17:48:16,796 INFO org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegionServer: Flushing MyTable,,1365111467842.f6792086ad3518dee244e7bf2761a1f9.

.............

The above logs continued and created around 38 files.

Later when the RS was restarted 


2013-04-04 18:36:18,007 INFO org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.compactions.DefaultCompactionPolicy: Default compaction algorithm has selected 38 files from 38 candidates

The compaction happeneded for the 38 files.
The reason for the above is this, USer triggered flushes happen thro
HRS.flushRegion()


FlushRegionResponse.Builder builder = FlushRegionResponse.newBuilder();

      if (shouldFlush) {

        builder.setFlushed(region.flushcache());

      }

      builder.setLastFlushTime(region.getLastFlushTime());

      return builder.build();

Here we call region.flushCache but the return value is never used. The return value is nothing but the variable which says a compaction is needed after this flush or not (that is returned by internalFlushCache). In the HRS.flushRegion method the return value is ignored.
But the same when it happens thro MemstoreFlusher the return value is used and we call requestCompaction.


try {

      boolean shouldCompact = region.flushcache();

      // We just want to check the size

      boolean shouldSplit = region.checkSplit() != null;

      if (shouldSplit) {

        this.server.compactSplitThread.requestSplit(region);

      } else if (shouldCompact) {

        server.compactSplitThread.requestCompaction(region, Thread.currentThread().getName());

      }

Doing the above step in HRS.flushRegion() should be enough i feel.
I had a doubt here if user triggered flush had to behave differently. The same can be observed in the 0.94 code also.
item.summary: User triggered flushes does not allow compaction to get triggered even if compaction criteria is met

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Also pls note that in the attached logs


compaction requested=true

so always compaction criteria was getting met.

flushcache() calls internalFlushcache() but their javadoc for return values state different meaning:


   * @return true if the region needs compacting

   * @throws IOException

   * @see #internalFlushcache(MonitoredTask)

   */

  protected boolean internalFlushcache(



   * @return true if cache was flushed

   *

   * @throws IOException general io exceptions

   * @throws DroppedSnapshotException Thrown when replay of hlog is required

   * because a Snapshot was not properly persisted.

   */

  public boolean flushcache() throws IOException {

I think javadoc in flushcache() should be consistent with javadoc in internalFlushcache().

Doing the above step in HRS.flushRegion() should be enough i feel.

+1

I think javadoc in flushcache() should be consistent with javadoc in internalFlushcache().

Yes Ted, I also observed this inconsistency while going through the code after Ram's mail. We can correct this also.
I will work on this JIRA today and make the necessary changes.

Patch for trunk. Tried to write a testcase but later did not update in the patch. Pls review and let me know if a testcase would be needed for this.
Because flush and compaction both are asynchronous

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12577513/HBASE-8282_trunk.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestHTableMultiplexer

-1 core zombie tests. There are 1 zombie test(s): at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.TestMasterObserver.testRegionTransitionOperations(TestMasterObserver.java:1185)

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5183//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5183//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-client.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5183//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-examples.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5183//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-protocol.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5183//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop1-compat.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5183//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-prefix-tree.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5183//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-common.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5183//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop-compat.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5183//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-server.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5183//console

This message is automatically generated.
Patch looks good.

builder.setFlushed(shouldCompact);

Are "was flushed" and "has to compact" always the same?

@Sergey
What do you mean here? So you say that we need to do builder.setFlushed() if something was flushed rather than setting the return value from flushCache()? Because the return value infact says about compaction and not flushing, am i right?
If internalFlushCache is reached (in flushCache) and no exception is thrown the cache was flushed; in that case we should return true instead of the needsCompaction indication.
I would like to cut 0.94.7RC on Monday. If we can't fix this soon I would like to move this out to 0.94.8.
I will check this and get back to you before your time on Monday. If not pls feel free to move to 0.94.8.

@Lars,
HRegion.flushCache() is used in two places. One is in Memstoreflusher.


try {

      boolean shouldCompact = region.flushcache();

      // We just want to check the size

      boolean shouldSplit = region.checkSplit() != null;

      if (shouldSplit) {

        this.server.compactSplitThread.requestSplit(region);

      } else if (shouldCompact) {

        server.compactSplitThread.requestCompaction(region, Thread.currentThread().getName());

      }

So if we need to return true if flush has happened without error in this case then we may have to overload the method or add another flushCache() which just does as stated by you Lars. What do you feel?
As long as it has one meaning it should be ok. I was surprised that it was seemingly changed. Sorry for delay. +1

What I am saying is that this:


+        builder.setFlushed(shouldCompact);

makes no sense. It should just be: 


+        builder.setFlushed(true);
Let's finish in 0.94.8.
ramkrishna.s.vasudevan mind updating the patch with Lar's suggestion?
Will do that today.

I have renamed the return variable to result rather than shouldCompact.
To find whether the return was from internalFlushCache or not we need to change the parameter of flushCache() by passing some Boolean object and setting the return value on that and also the HRegion.flushCache() is getting used in many places thro out the code.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12580548/HBASE-8282_trunk_1.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

-1 release audit. The applied patch generated 1 release audit warnings (more than the trunk's current 0 warnings).

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Sorry to be pedantic, but isn't this part still wrong:


+        builder.setFlushed(result);

Result indicates whether we a compaction. I still think it should just be builder.setFlushed(true);

@Lars
No problem Lars.
So whether we flush it or not, we still set setFlushed(true) is it?
This confusion is because HRegion.flushCache() sometimes returns false if really the flush did not proceed and sometimes returns false if there was no need for compaction.
So if we always make builder.setflushed(true) then we are not setting the right information based on the stmt above.

HRegion.flushCache() sometimes returns false if really the flush did not proceed and sometimes returns false if there was no need for compaction

That looks bad.. We can try fixing it (In another jira?)

I agree with Lars that we should return whether flush is happened or not.. Internally the flush might triggered a compaction but might not be worth telling that back to the user.
Let's commit this patch as is and work on further improvements in a new jira.
I'll commit as is later tonight unless I hear objections.
Committed to trunk and 0.95 Lars.
Raised HBASE-8578 for improvements.

Patch for 0.94. The changes are to be done in all the 3 flavours of flushCache.

0.94 patch looks good +1.

A comment though, that maybe I should've made a bit earlier: Isn't it a good thing that the user has a bit more control here? A manual flush was issued presumably to force data out of the memstore to stable storage (either to reduce recovery cost in the event of a failure or because a bigger load was done with WAL writing disabled). Now we're slowing this process down because we may issue compaction requests. If the user wants to to flushes and compactions (s)he can always issue a flush followed by a compaction request.

Edit: Spelling.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12583948/HBASE-8282_0.94.patch
against trunk revision .

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.

Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.
